SUBJECT: FCC and related legal problems requiring action by
NAEB Board of Directors,
The most important unfinished business remaining after our
Board of Directors meeting in Columbus concerns various PCC and
legal problems© You will recall that we hoped to have Leonard
Marks with us then* but unfortunately pressing business held him
in Washington©
Accordingly* when I went to Washington last week for the
meeting of the Joint council on Educational Television* I reviewed
these matters with him* and am reporting the results here for
your information© I should appreciate your immediate reaction
to those items on which we need to take action now* as well as
your comments on all the other items listed below©
1„ Television Allocations Table© On April 27* the Federal
Communications Commission proposed the abandonment of the existing
television allocations table (retaining, however, educational
reservations), on the grounds that the reasons given in the Sixth
Report and Order for its adoption were no longer valid© The
original reasons were: the table would make for a more efficient
use of the available channels; would better protect the interests
of smaller communities and rural areas by preventing the preemption
of available channels by the larger cities; would be an effective
means of reserving channels for educational purposes; and would
expedite the processing of applications©
